poem:
Title: "In the Midst of the Sugar-Coated Sea"

Amid the rolling waves of wheat,
Puppeteers of flavour and cachet,
Courage sought from the silent seat.
Slimming the giants of our feast,
Stripping fat, salt, and the proclaimant sweet.
A healthier path for man and beast,
Yet, in the cost, do we lose the taste
Of life's rewarding, simplest treat?
